alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 21 at 3:10PM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 8 PM EDT FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 8 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...East Carteret County, and Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...From 5 PM Thursday to 8 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Swell from Major Hurricane Fiona will bring dangerous surf to beaches from Cape Lookout North to south of Oregon Inlet. Seas build to 5-8 feet by late Thursday morning and then 6-10 feet by Thursday evening with seas remaining above 8 feet until Friday evening. Minor ocean overwash will also be possible across oceanside beaches including Rodanthe, Hatteras, and Ocracoke.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island
